intro: Navarretia mitracarpa, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Navarretia mitracarpa is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in areas with limited soil and moisture.
